title: Controversy erupted after a replica of the Qur'an was discovered within the bogs of a well-liked retailer in Israel - World Today News
text:
A video clip of a torn copy of the Qur’an discovered within the bogs of a big retailer in Israel owned by a distinguished businessman sparked controversy, and the police opened an investigation into the matter.
And he agreed report Revealed by the Israel Broadcasting Authority “Makan” employees in a “chain of outlets” within the metropolis of Haifa discovered a torn copy of the Qur’an, and one of many employees, whose identification was withheld, stated , that greater than as soon as he discovered pages torn from the Qur’an thrown both within the trash or within the bogs.
The Qur’an is taken into account the holiest ebook amongst Muslims.
“Outlets Community” is likely one of the giant shops owned by the Israeli businessman, Rami Levy.
The worker instructed Makan that he went to the department supervisor and instructed him what he discovered and the way the case was repeated, noting that he and several other employees -another job “threatened to go on strike till the one that dedicated the crime was revealed.”
However after a number of days, the department supervisor instructed them “he could not do something,” so that they went to the department safety director, who did nothing, and that is what made them go to the media.
Department supervisor Shimon Malka stated, “An investigation was carried out to seek out out what occurred… however there aren’t any cameras within the bogs to take care of privateness, and we tried to ask and examine what precisely that occurred “
He confirmed that everybody “within the retailer lives in a particular concord, as a result of many Christians, Muslims and Jews come to him,” expressing his “sorrow” for the occurred
The proprietor of the shop, Rami Levy, of the Israel Broadcasting Company, “tried to reduce” and even “deny” what occurred.
However after being confronted with a video of the torn copy of the Qur’an, he confirmed that he was “towards what occurred, whether or not it was the Torah or the Holy Ebook of Christians or Muslims. “
Levy confirmed that “each worker prays every time they need,” stressing that “everybody has his personal faith, and it’s forbidden to assault religions different individuals. “
He stated that if the one that did this was identified, he can be “fired.”
The “Makan” report identified that such an occasion may create “pressure” within the nation which is “mandatory” at the moment.
